result.execSummary:
The defendant Meghan L Bochat was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery-Uttering, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Restitution payable to ST BERNARD'S for TWO THOUSAND FOUR HUNDRED AND FIFTY DOLLARS ($2,450.00) or civil judgment with tax intercept. Bail to be applied if applicable

Pay all applicable costs, surcharges and supervision fees or civil judgment will be entered with tax intercept.
Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.

The Court ordered that all court costs, fees, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision on Case 15CF3036. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and tax intercept or other means.

-Successfully complete recommended treatment
-Maintain absolute sobriety. NO drugs. NO alcohol
-Random urine screens and breathalyzer tests

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon, she may never possess a firearm or body armor and that her voting rights are suspended and she may not vote in  any election until her civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Meghan L Bochat

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: DENYING Request for Concurrent Sentences.  Signed, scanned and filed, sdg.
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Carl Ashley, Br. 33, for review. mag
Defendant's pro se request for concurrent sentences in 15CF002147 and 15CF003036.

Certification of transcript of proceedings of SENTENCING commencing AUGUST 19, 2016 received and filed. (24 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to INSTITUTION.

Defendant Meghan L Bochat in court with attorney Debra Jeanne Patterson.  Defendant Meghan L Bochat in custody.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Statements made as to sentencing by State, Defense and Defendant.  Additional statements by:  JAYNE B.

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of ONE HUNDRED (100) DAYS with credit for ONE HUNDRED (100) DAYS time served;  TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

OTHER CONDITIONS:

* Mental Health Evaluation and take all prescribed medications.
* Medically assisted treatment if appropriate.
* Complete any and all other counselling deemed appropriate.
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer tests.
* Obtain and maintain employment.
* Restitution payable to ST BERNARD'S for TWO THOUSAND FOUR HUNDRED AND FIFTY DOLLARS ($2,450.00) or civil judgment with tax intercept.  Bail to be applied if applicable.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs, surcharges and supervision fees or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered WITH tax intercept.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon she may never possess a firearm or body armor.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and she may not vote in any election until her civil rights are restored.

The Court ordered that all court costs, fees, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision ON CASE 15CF3036.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and tax intercept or other means.

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Post-conviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Defendant Meghan L Bochat in court with attorney Debra Jeanne Patterson.  Defendant Meghan L Bochat in custody.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

DTC - PHASE I

Review hearing proceeded on the Record.  Court held colloquy with the Defendant.  The defendant is not in compliance with the terms of the Milwaukee County Drug Court Deferred Prosecution Agreement.  Based upon the defendant's non-compliance and State's motion, the court revoked the Milwaukee County Drug Court Deferred Prosecution Agreement; proceedings reinstated.  Court orders entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Br. 33.  DEFENDANT IS REMANDED PENDING THE NEXT DATE. Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.
Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum  and Elements/Jury Instructions, received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information.  Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed.  Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 6.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant momentarily pled not guilty.
As a condition of bail, court order the defendant may not possess dangerous weapons or firearms or apply for a conceal carry permit.

Defendant Meghan L Bochat in court with attorney Dawn Marie Rablin.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defense waived reading and momentarily enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of client.  Review hearing scheduled for July 13, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Court appearance scheduled in Room 310, Safety Building, on 5/18/15 @ 1:30pm
